intro: Olgaea echinantha, commonly known as the spiny olgaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spiny stems and velvety leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Olgaea echinantha is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
